quotes: In 1981 Salim presented his candidature for the position of secretary-general.

time_markers.text: over a period of five weeks
quotes: The protracted election process was repeated 16 times over a period of five weeks,
and in 1992, Boutros Boutros-Ghali of Egypt was elected as the first African UN secretary-general,
followed by Kofi Annan of Ghana in 1997.

organizations.name: Security Council
quotes: The US and China, in their positions as permanent members, used their veto powers against each other’s preferred candidates.
The process of voting in a secretary-general requires the support, or at least non-opposition, of all the permanent members of the Security Council
to communicate to the Security Council that he did not wish his name to be considered for a subsequent vote.
It became increasingly difficult for one permanent member of the Security Council to block competent candidates when there was strong support from other members.

organizations.name: UNGA
quotes: The process of voting in a secretary-general requires the support, or at least non-opposition, of all the permanent members of the Security Council and a majority vote from the UNGA.

organizations.name: OAU
quotes: These appointments came about as a result of action by the OAU and the NAM to mobilise support for the candidacy and election of an African secretary-general.
